definition: to blend/to integrate/to amalgamate/to fuse
to melt/to thaw/to blend/to merge/to be in harmony
old variant of 融[rong2]
to balance an account/accountancy/accounting
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
to master the subject via a comprehensive study of surrounding areas

sentences.english: I cannot digest all this information.
sentences.chinese: 我不能将所有的信息融会贯通。

sentences.english: Once the salts melt, a gray-white substance is left. This is potash.
sentences.chinese: 一旦盐份融会，会留下灰白色的物质，这就是碳酸钾。

sentences.english: It studies the book methodology concentrated expression is"achieves mastery through a comprehensive study"the thought and the method.
sentences.chinese: 其学书方法论集中表现为“融会贯通”的思想和方法。

sentences.english: It uses the methods in physics, electrical transfixion double-sided circuit connection.
sentences.chinese: 它拔取物理的办法，融会双面的导电线路拆开。

sentences.english: Jedi Knight's attunement to the Force more than compensates for these compromises.
sentences.chinese: 绝地武士对原力的融会贯通更能弥补这些不足。

sentences.english: He believes understanding, rather than memorization, is the most important part of studying.
sentences.chinese: 他相信学习之道在乎融会贯通，而非强记背诵。

sentences.english: Do not count on last minute cramming right before exams to do well.
sentences.chinese: 不要考试前的最后工夫里靠融会贯通去取的好成绩。

definition: fusion/to combine as one
mix together/put together (usu. things that do not blend well together)
to master the subject via a comprehensive study of surrounding areas
incorporating diverse things (idiom)/eclectic/all-embracing
to form a cohesive whole/to fuse together
to blend/to mix
to have a style of one's own
to merge together (idiom); to unify disparate elements into one whole
to contain two things at a time/to mingle/to incorporate
warm/agreeable
mix
quintessence/essentials
a blend/a mix
lit. spirit and marrow/the essential character
to circulate/to flow (esp. capital)/to intermingle/to merge/to become assimilated
to develop/to evolve
